greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Powering the decimal digits of n (left-associative).
comment: See A256229 for the (maybe more natural) "right-associative" variant, a(xyz)=x^(y^z). a(n) = A256229(n) for n < 212 (up to 210, according to the 2nd formula which also holds for A256229), but (2^1)^2 = 4 while 2^(1^2) = 1. - _M. F. Hasler_, Mar 22 2015
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = if n < 10 then n else a(floor(n\10))^(n mod 10).
a(n) = 1 iff the initial digit is 1 or n contains a 0 (i.e., A055641(n) > 0 or A000030(n) = 1);
a(n) = A133500(n) for n <= 99. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 27 2013
program: a075877 n = if n < 10 then n else a075877 (n `div` 10) ^ (n `mod` 10)
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 16 2002
